Local Government (Review) Order 1999

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council and on the recommendation of the Minister, make the following order under section 12 of the Local Government Act 1993 .

3 February 1999

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

J. A. BACON

Premier

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Local Government (Review) Order 1999 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Interpretation
    The Acts Interpretation Act 1931 applies to the interpretation of this order as if it were by-laws.

4. Abolition of certain electoral districts
    The electoral districts of the municipal area of Launceston are abolished.

5. Number of councillors for Sorell
        (1) The total number of persons to be elected as councillors in the municipal area of Sorell is as follows:
                (a) 11, following the election due in March 1999;
                (b) 9, following the election due in October 2000.
        (2) The total number of persons as referred to in subclause (1)(a) is to be achieved by reducing the number of persons to be elected as councillors in 1999 from 6 to 5.
        (3) The total number of persons as referred to in subclause (1)(b) is to be achieved by reducing the number of persons to be elected as councillors in 2000 from 6 to 4.

6.
    The amendments effected by this clause have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Local Government Act 1993 .

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 4 February 1999

This order is administered in the Department of Premier and Cabinet.
